intro: Mentha transmota, commonly known as Mexican mint, is a perennial herb native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that emit a strong minty fragrance. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or pink and bloom in clusters during the summer months. Mentha transmota is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its refreshing aroma and potential health benefits.
